pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with Nova Scotia Premier Stephen McNeil | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Yesterday, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with Nova Scotia Premier Stephen McNeil following the shooting in Portapique.

Prime Minister Trudeau expressed his sincere condolences to Premier McNeil for the loss of lives in Portapique, including one member of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, Cst. Heidi Stevenson. Both leaders also hoped for a full recovery for the people who were injured. The Prime Minister offered his full support to the people of Nova Scotia during this difficult time. Both leaders expressed profound appreciation for the work of the RCMP and first responders.

The two leaders also discussed the impacts of the COVID-19 epidemic on the province of Nova Scotia, and agreed to stay in touch.
